description.narrative: This Project is implemented in Ethiopia, in 20 towns spread out in four regions. The main objective is to improve WaSH service delivery and access to water and sanitation services by implementing a model capacity building program for urban WASH actors that can be scalable in other towns and countries. Specifically the project will carry out activities (1) To enhance the performance of the towns' utilities in water supply by 20% to agreed business plan targets by the end of the project period (2) To improve the performance of sanitation and hygiene service providers in target towns by 20% above the baseline and (3) To improve documentation, learning, Knowledge management and network between town's in Ethiopia and East Africa. Phase 1 was a five years project between 01 April 2014 - 31 March 2019 with a total budget of Birr 28,220,000.00. The target groups are the town Water boards, utility operators, municipalities and health offices of the 20 towns as well as the capacity building unit of the Ministry of Water and Energy. The final beneficiaries are the dwellers or the communities of the targeted 20 towns in which are approximately 914,847.00. Moreover, this project will also benefit the WaSH ministries and Regional bureaus to design and implement capacity development plans in other towns.Phase 2 - In development

mailing-address.narrative: Open data at WaterAid, 47-49 Durham Street, London, SE11 5JD, UK
